highlights.title: THE TRUTH ABOUT SINGLE MOMS
highlights.reason: This is a perfect 'listicle' style rant. The host lists every downside of dating a single mother (stats, ex-husband, trauma) in a continuous flow. It builds up to a strong conclusion calling men 'stupid' for ignoring the logic. 39 seconds allows the full argument to land.

highlights.title: SOCIETY DIDN'T FORCE YOU
highlights.reason: High-energy confrontation. The host directly attacks the lack of accountability ('Society didn't force you to sleep with a lot of guys'). It starts with a strong hook reacting to her blame-shifting and ends with a definitive insult.

highlights.title: SIMPS CREATE ENTITLEMENT
highlights.reason: This segment explains the 'why' behind the behavior. It connects men's weak behavior (simping) to women's entitlement. It has a clear narrative arc: If men stopped simping -> women would vet better -> divorce would drop. Ends on a strong realization about 'baby daddies'.

highlights.title: ACCOUNTABILITY IS KRYPTONITE
highlights.reason: Contrasts a woman's past behavior ('I was a hoe') with her current victimhood ('It's society's fault'). The length allows the viewer to understand exactly what she is hypocritical about before the host delivers the 'you look like a simp' punchline.

highlights.title: SITUATIONSHIPS = OUT OF YOUR LEAGUE
highlights.reason: A direct reality check for women complaining about 'situationships'. The host flips the script to say it's because the man is out of her league. Ends on a strong thematic summary: 'Can you see how they remove all accountability?'

highlights.title: MEN GAVE YOU RIGHTS
highlights.reason: Extremely polarizing take on patriarchy and voting rights. By starting at 13:25, we get the context of the 'Afghanistan' comparison, leading into the host's point that men voluntarily gave up power. Guaranteed engagement driver.

highlights.title: SINGLE MOTHERS ARE BELOW AVERAGE
highlights.reason: One of the harshest takes in the video. He explicitly states 'she's a single mother... she's below average.' The 24s duration allows him to explain that the guy 'doesn't even remember talking to her,' proving his point about her market value.
